channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report X-2024051043
item.description:

  • Description: NO LABEL ON PACKAGE TO DECLARE IT AS A HAZMAT. BAG ON INNER PACKAGE WAS RIPPED AND SOME OF THE CONTENTS LEAKED OUT.

item.title: Report X-2024050598
item.description:
Report X-2024050598

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO DOOR 25 ON THE UNLOAD FOR A WET HAZMAT. UPON ARRIVING FOUND THAT HAZMAT WAS SITTING THE GRAIT OUTSIDE THE TRAILER. IT WAS PUT IN A SPILL TRAY AND TAKEN BACK TO BE PROCESS.

item.title: Report E-2024050271
item.description:
Report E-2024050271

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 2 gallons of SOFT TOUCH CLEAR was released from two damaged 5-gallon metal drums due to improper blocking. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, and they felt comfortable that terminal personnel could clean the release with the personal protective equipment available on-site.
